block.p: Sara Duffy, the daughter of Michaela Minden Duffy of Manhattan and Paul Duffy of Falmouth, Mass., was married on Nantucket yesterday to Nathanael Wade Greene, the son of Susanne and Wade Greene of New York and Nantucket. The Rev. Georgia Anne Snell, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Wade Cottages, a bed-and-breakfast owned by the bridegroom's parents in Siasconset, Mass.

Ms. Duffy, 30, is keeping her name. She is studying for an associate's degree in interior design at the Fashion Institute of Technology and is also the materials librarian at the Rockwell Group, an architectural firm in New York. She is a graduate of Ohio Wesleyan University. Her father is a columnist for The Barnstable Patriot in Hyannis, Mass., and The Vermont Times in Shelburne. Her mother is a senior designer at MAC II Interior Design in New York.

Sara Duffy, the daughter of Michaela Minden Duffy of Manhattan and Paul Duffy of Falmouth, Mass., was married on Nantucket yesterday to Nathanael Wade Greene, the son of Susanne and Wade Greene of New York and Nantucket. The Rev. Georgia Anne Snell, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Wade Cottages, a bed-and-breakfast owned by the bridegroom's parents in Siasconset, Mass.

Ms. Duffy, 30, is keeping her name. She is studying for an associate's degree in interior design at the Fashion Institute of Technology and is also the materials librarian at the Rockwell Group, an architectural firm in New York. She is a graduate of Ohio Wesleyan University. Her father is a columnist for The Barnstable Patriot in Hyannis, Mass., and The Vermont Times in Shelburne. Her mother is a senior designer at MAC II Interior Design in New York.

Mr. Greene, 31, is an analyst who specializes in energy and environmental issues for the Natural Resources Defense Council, the environmental organization in New York. He graduated from Brown University and received a master's degree in energy and resources from the University of California at Berkeley. His mother is a sculptor. His father is a writer on environmental and social issues for magazines, and also a philanthropic adviser to Rockefeller Financial Services, a Rockefeller family office in New York.
